statement.p: A worker's contract states that the hourly wage will start at 9.00 and will increase by \displaystyle{r}={2.5} annually, with half the annual raise given every 6 months.

The hourly wage can be modeled by the exponential formula \displaystyle{S}={P}{\left({1}+\frac{{r}}{{n}}\right)}^{{{n}{t}}}, where \displaystyle{S} is the future value, \displaystyle{P} is the present value, \displaystyle{r} is the (nominal or stated) annual rate of increase, \displaystyle{n} is the number of times each year that the wage is increased, and \displaystyle{t} is the time in years.
(A) What values should be used for \displaystyle{P}, r, and \displaystyle{n}?
(B) The final hourly wage in \displaystyle{10} years will equal which dollar amount?
